com.tailf.jnc
Class TCPConnection

java.lang.Object
  com.tailf.jnc.TCPConnection

public class TCPConnection
extends java.lang.Object

A TCP NETCONF connection class. This is a symmetrical class to the SSHConnection.

Note: TCP is not a standardized way to connect to a NETCONF device. It will only work when connecting to a ConfD agent and should only be used for testing. Use SSHConnection and SSHSession instead.

Example: 

 TCPConnection conn = new TCPConnection("127.0.0.1", 2022);
 conn.authenticate("ola", "500", "500", "", "/home/ola", "");
 TCPSession sess = new TCPSession(conn);
 sess.addSubscriber(new DefaultIOSubscriber());
 NetconfSession dev1 = new NetconfSession(sess);

TCPConnection

public TCPConnection(java.lang.String host,
                     int port,
                     java.lang.String username,
                     java.lang.String uid,
                     java.lang.String gid,
                     java.lang.String suplgids,
                     java.lang.String dir,
                     java.lang.String groups)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     java.net.UnknownHostException,
                     JNCException
Creates a new TCP connection object. Connects towards a ConfD NETCONF agent and authenticates.

This only works towards ConfD agent since NETCONF/TCP not is a standard transport mechanism.

It is provided to be symmetrical to the SSHConnection class, and should only be used for debugging purposes.

Initial authentication string towards ConfD looks like: [Username;127.0.0.1;tcp;UID;GID;SUPLGIDS;DIR;GROUPS;]

Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.net.UnknownHostException
JNCException

authenticate

public void authenticate(java.lang.String username,
                         java.lang.String uid,
                         java.lang.String gid,
                         java.lang.String suplgids,
                         java.lang.String dir,
                         java.lang.String groups)
Authenticate towards the ConfD NETCONF Agent.

The Initial connection string towards ConfD to authenticate looks like: [Username;127.0.0.1;tcp;UID;GID;SUPLGIDS;DIR;GROUPS;]

Parameters:
username - The user name
uid -
gid -
suplgids -
